location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/4 Naval & Shipping: Salutes to Arab Rulers'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 23, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: Correspondence and other papers relating to the question of appropriate gun salutes for deputies appointed during a ruling Shaikh's absence. The question is applied to Abu Dhabi, Aden, Ajman, Bahrain, Dubai, Kuwait, Muscat, Qatar, Ras al-Khaimah, Sharjah, and Umm al-Qaiwain. The correspondence comes from: the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, Bushire; the Political Agent, Muscat; and the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain.
